ddf_utils.chef.cook module¶

recipe cooking

ddf_utils.chef.cook.build_dag(recipe)¶
ddf_utils.chef.cook.build_recipe(recipe_file, to_disk=False, **kwargs)¶

build a complete recipe file if there are includes in recipe file, if no includes found than return the file as is.

ddf_utils.chef.cook.check_dataset_availability(recipe)¶

check availability of all datasets required by the recipe.

raise error if some dataset not available. otherwise do nothing.

ddf_utils.chef.cook.dish_to_csv(dishes, outpath)¶
ddf_utils.chef.cook.run_recipe(recipe)¶

run the recipe.

returns a dictionary. keys are concepts, entities and datapoints, and values are ingredients return by the procedures

ddf_utils.chef.cook.update_recipe_last_update(recipe, outdir)¶

this function makes copy of self.data.

dtype¶

returns the type of ddf data, i.e. concepts/entities/datapoints.

It will be inferred from the key property of ingredient. TODO: what if key == ‘*’? Is it possible?

ddf_utils.chef.procedure module¶

all procedures for recipes

make copy of ingredient data, with new names.

dictionary: a dictionary of oldname -> newname mappings

ddf_utils.chef.procedure.filter_row(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.ProcedureResult¶

filter an ingredient based on a set of options and return the result as new ingredient.

Args:
ingredient: Ingredient object result: ingred_id of return ingredient options: dict of options
available options:
dictionary: test
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.groupby(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient, *, result, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.ProcedureResult¶

group ingredient data by column(s) and run aggregate function

available options:
groubby: the column(s) to group, can be a list or a string aggregate/transform/filter: the function to run. only one of them should be supplied.

The function block should have below format:

aggregate:
column1: funcname1 column2: funcname2

or

aggregate:
column:
function: funcname param1: foo param2: bar

other columns not mentioned will be dropped.

ddf_utils.chef.procedure.identity(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient¶

return the ingredient as is.

available options:
copy: if copy is True, then treat all data as string. Default: False
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.merge(*ingredients: typing.List[ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient], result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.ProcedureResult¶

the main merge function

avaliable options:
deep: if True, then do deep merging. Default is False
About deep merging:
deep merge is when we check every datapoint for existence if false, overwrite is on the file level. If key-value (e.g. geo,year-population_total) exists, whole file gets overwritten if true, overwrite is on the row level. If values (e.g. afr,2015-population_total) exists, it gets overwritten, if it doesn’t it stays
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.run_op(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.ProcedureResult¶

run math operation on each row of ingredient data.

available options:
op: a dictionary of concept_name: function mapping
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.translate_column(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.ProcedureResult¶

Translate column values.

available options are:
dictionary: a dictionary of oldname -> newname mappings column: the column to rename base: if base is provided, transform the columns base on information of base ingredient. So that oldname column will be change to values from newname column.
Note:
if base and column are provided at same time, it will raise an error.
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.translate_header(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient, *, result=None, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.ProcedureResult¶

Translate column headers

available options are:
dictionary: a dictionary of oldname -> newname mappings
ddf_utils.chef.procedure.trend_bridge(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient, result, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.ProcedureResult¶

run trend bridge on ingredients

ddf_utils.chef.procedure.window(ingredient: ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.BaseIngredient, result, **options) → ddf_utils.chef.ingredient.ProcedureResult¶

apply functions on a rolling window

available options: window: dictionary

window definition. options are: column: str, column which window is created from size: int or ‘expanding’, if int then rolling window, if expanding then expanding window min_periods: int, as in pandas center: bool, as in pandas
aggregate: dictionary
aggregation functions, format should be column: func or column: {function: func, param1: foo, param2: baz, ...}

ddf_utils.chef.dag module¶

the DAG module of chef

class ddf_utils.chef.dag.BaseNode(node_id, dag)¶

Bases: object

add_downstream(node)¶
add_upstream(node)¶
detect_downstream_cycle(task=None)¶

When invoked, this routine will raise an exception if a cycle is detected downstream from self. It is invoked when tasks are added to the DAG to detect cycles.

downstream_list¶
